meanings.definition: Amauroses: plural form of amaurosis, a partial or total loss of sight without visible disease of the eye; blindness.
meanings.sent1: The doctor diagnosed him with amauroses after he experienced sudden blindness in both eyes.
meanings.sent2: Many elderly individuals suffer from amauroses as they age, leading to challenges in daily activities.
meanings.sent3: Despite wearing sunglasses indoors, his case of amauroses made him bump into furniture frequently.
meanings.sent4: Her fear of the dark was like living in a world of amauroses, where everything was shrouded in darkness.
meanings.sent5: The artist painted a haunting picture depicting the feeling of amauroses, capturing the loss of sight in a powerful way.
